paper_abstract: The problem of building an a"" (0)-sampler is to sample near-uniformly from the support set of a dynamic multiset. This problem has a variety of applications within data analysis, computational geometry and graph algorithms. In this paper, we abstract a set of steps for building an a"" (0)-sampler, based on sampling, recovery and selection. We analyze the implementation of an a"" (0)-sampler within this framework, and show how prior constructions of a"" (0)-samplers can all be expressed in terms of these steps. Our experimental contribution is to provide a first detailed study of the accuracy and computational cost of a"" (0)-samplers.
paper_title: A unifying framework for l(0)-sampling algorithms
